RoyalTitleDef.label: Augustus
RoyalTitleDef.description: After several particularly despotic Padishah-emperors and bloody revolutions, the imperial authorities decided to introduce the title of augustus, co-emperors, whose main purpose is to limit the power of the monarch. As the heads of the Great Houses, such co-emperors do not receive any real power, but they do have additional abilities, such as vetoing the most controversial laws, provided they have the support of the other noble Houses.
